intro: Alsodeia guatemalensis, commonly known as Guatemalan alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and sometimes edible parts. The plant typically features slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are often alternate and have a slightly succulent texture, adapted to thrive in dry environments. Alsodeia guatemalensis is often found in rocky or disturbed soils, showcasing its resilience in less hospitable conditions.
